title: Edwardian Era Elegance
description: The early 1900s fashion featured S-shaped corsets, high collars, and lavish gowns that emphasized formality and femininity.

title: Poiret and the Birth of Modernism
description: Designer Paul Poiret rejected corsets, introducing free-flowing silhouettes and bold colors that shaped early modern fashion.
imageURL: Poiret and the Birth of Modernism.jpg

title: The Flapper Revolution
description: The roaring twenties introduced short hemlines, fringe, beads, and bobbed hair. Fashion reflected women's liberation and nightlife culture.

title: Hollywood Glamour
description: Fashion in the 1930s turned to bias-cut gowns, satin fabrics, and long lines inspired by silver screen stars like Jean Harlow and Marlene Dietrich.

title: Utility and Wartime Fashion
description: World War II led to rationing, resulting in simple, structured silhouettes, shorter skirts, and functional fashion for women in the workforce.

title: Rise of Punk & Street Fashion
description: The punk movement brought rebellion to the runway â€” safety pins, ripped clothes, leather, and Vivienne Westwood defined the 1977 street style.

title: Power Dressing
description: The 1980s embraced shoulder pads, bold colors, and corporate chic as women made their mark in the workplace.

title: Y2K Revival
description: Low-rise jeans, shiny fabrics, and futuristic styles defined early 2000s fashion trends.
